      59           0 : struct AnimationProperty
      60             : {
      61             :   nsCSSPropertyID mProperty = eCSSProperty_UNKNOWN;
      62             : 
      63             :   // If true, the propery is currently being animated on the compositor.
      64             :   //
      65             :   // Note that when the owning Animation requests a non-throttled restyle, in
      66             :   // between calling RequestRestyle on its EffectCompositor and when the
      67             :   // restyle is performed, this member may temporarily become false even if
      68             :   // the animation remains on the layer after the restyle.
      69             :   //
      70             :   // **NOTE**: This member is not included when comparing AnimationProperty
      71             :   // objects for equality.
      72             :   bool mIsRunningOnCompositor = false;
      73             : 
      74             :   Maybe<AnimationPerformanceWarning> mPerformanceWarning;
      75             : 
      76             :   InfallibleTArray<AnimationPropertySegment> mSegments;
      77             : 
      78             :   // The copy constructor/assignment doesn't copy mIsRunningOnCompositor and
      79             :   // mPerformanceWarning.
      80           0 :   AnimationProperty() = default;
      81           0 :   AnimationProperty(const AnimationProperty& aOther)
      82           0 :     : mProperty(aOther.mProperty), mSegments(aOther.mSegments) { }
      83             :   AnimationProperty& operator=(const AnimationProperty& aOther)
      84             :   {
      85             :     mProperty = aOther.mProperty;
      86             :     mSegments = aOther.mSegments;
      87             :     return *this;
      88             :   }
      89             : 
      90             :   // NOTE: This operator does *not* compare the mIsRunningOnCompositor member.
      91             :   // This is because AnimationProperty objects are compared when recreating
      92             :   // CSS animations to determine if mutation observer change records need to
      93             :   // be created or not. However, at the point when these objects are compared
      94             :   // the mIsRunningOnCompositor will not have been set on the new objects so
      95             :   // we ignore this member to avoid generating spurious change records.
      96           0 :   bool operator==(const AnimationProperty& aOther) const

      98           0 :     return mProperty == aOther.mProperty &&
      99           0 :            mSegments == aOther.mSegments;
